member.name: T:J#Type
member.summary: Provides a typing and type-reflection system for ECMAScript (JavaScript) object-oriented programming functionality.

member.name: M:J#Type.callBaseMethod
member.summary: Invokes a base method with specified arguments.
member.returns: A value of the class that the base method returns. If the base method does not return a value, no value is returned.
member.param: The instance whose base method is being called. Usually this.
A string that represents the name of the base method.
(Optional) An array of arguments to pass to the base method. Can be null or an object that has a null element.
member.exception: (Debug) does not exist for the base class.

member.name: M:J#Type.getBaseMethod
member.summary: Returns the base implementation of a method from the base class of the specified instance.
member.returns: Returns the base implementation of the method from the base class of , or null if the method does not exist in .
member.param: The instance for which the base method is requested.
The name of the method to retrieve as a reference.
member.exception: (Debug) is not an instance of the current type.

member.name: M:J#Type.getBaseType
member.summary: Returns the base class of the instance.
member.returns: The base class of the instance.

member.name: M:J#Type.getInterfaces
member.summary: Returns an object that contains the list of interfaces that the type implements.
member.returns: An object that contains the list of interfaces that the type implements.

member.name: M:J#Type.getName
member.summary: Returns the name of the type of the instance.
member.returns: A string representing the fully qualified name of the type of the instance.

member.name: M:J#Type.implementsInterface
member.summary: Determines whether a class implements a specified interface type.
member.returns: true if the class implements ; otherwise, false.
member.param: The interface to test.

member.name: M:J#Type.inheritsFrom
member.summary: Determines whether an instance inherits from a specified class.
member.returns: true if the instance inherits from ; otherwise, false.
member.param: The fully qualified name of the class to test as a base class for the current instance.

member.name: M:J#Type.initializeBase
member.summary: Initializes the base class and its members in the context of a given instance, which provides the model for inheritance and for initializing base members.
member.returns: The instance of the base class.
member.param: The instance to initialize the base class for. Usually this.
(Optional) The arguments for the base constructor. Can be null.
member.exception: (Debug) is not of the same type as the current instance.

member.name: M:J#Type.isImplementedBy
member.summary: Determines whether an instance implements an interface.
member.returns: true if implements the interface; false if does not implement the interface, or if it is undefined or null.
member.param: The instance on which the interface is tested.

member.name: M:J#Type.isInstanceOfType
member.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether an object is an instance of a specified class or of one of its derived classes.
member.returns: true if is an instance of the class; false if does not implement the interface, or if it is undefined or null.
member.param: The object to test.

member.name: M:J#Type.registerClass
member.summary: Registers a class as defined by a constructor with an optional base type and interface type.
member.returns: The registered type.
member.param: A string that represents the fully qualified name of the type.
(Optional) The base type.
(Optional) An unbounded array of interface type definitions that the type implements.
member.exception: (Debug) cannot be evaluated.-or-(Debug) is not a class.
(Debug) The class specified by is already registered.

member.name: M:J#Type.registerInterface
member.summary: Registers an interface defined by a constructor.
member.returns: The registered interface.
member.param: A string that represents the fully qualified name of the class to be registered as an interface.
member.exception: (Debug) cannot be evaluated as a defined type.
(Debug) The interface specified by is already registered.

member.name: M:J#Type.resolveInheritance
member.summary: Copies members from the base class to the prototype associated with the derived class, and continues this process up the inheritance chain. This enables you to reflect on the inherited members of a derived type.

member.name: M:J#Array.forEach
member.summary: Calls a specified function for each element of an object. This function is static and can be invoked without creating an instance of the object.

The function to call for each element in the array.
The context for calling .

member.name: M:J#Array.indexOf
member.summary: Searches for the specified element of an object and returns its index. This function is static and can be invoked without creating an instance of the object.
member.returns: A number that represents the index location of in the array, if found; otherwise, -1.In Mozilla Firefox, calling with not set or set to undefined returns the index of the first item with a value of undefined. All other browsers return -1 in these circumstances.
member.param: The array to search.
The object to find in the array.
(Optional) The index number that specifies the starting element for searching the array.

member.name: M:J#Array.insert
member.summary: Inserts a single item into a specified index of an object. This function is static and can be invoked without creating an instance of the object.
member.param: The array to insert the item into.
The index location where should be inserted.
The object to add to the array.

member.param: The string to convert to an array.
member.exception: (Debug) is formatted incorrectly.

member.name: M:J#Array.remove

member.name: M:J#Array.removeAt
member.summary: Removes an element from of an object at a specified index location. This function is static and can be invoked without creating an instance of the object.

member.summary: Formats a date by using the current culture. This function is static and can be invoked without creating an instance of the object.

member.name: M:J#Date.parseLocale
member.summary: Creates a date from a locale-specific string by using the current culture. This function is static and can be invoked without creating an instance of the object.
member.returns: If is a valid string representation of a date, an object of type ; otherwise, null.Use the function to create an object of type from a string. If you provide no custom formats, this function uses the property to determine the culture value.To create a date from a locale-specific string that uses the current culture, set the property of the control to true. You must also modify settings in the Web.config file so that the culture attribute of the <globalization> section is set to auto.
member.param: A locale-specific string that represents a date.
(Optional) An array of custom formats.
member.exception: (Debug) contains an invalid format.

member.summary: Creates a date from a string by using the invariant culture. This function is static and can be invoked without creating an instance of the object.
member.returns: If is a valid string representation of a date in the invariant format, an object of type ; otherwise, null.
member.param: A string that represents a date.
(Optional) An array of custom formats.

member.name: M:J#Sys.Net.WebServiceProxy.invoke
member.summary: Invokes the specified Web service method.
member.returns: The instance that is used to call the method. This instance can be used to stop the call.
member.param: The Web service URL. can be set to a fully qualified URL (http://www.mySite.com/myService.asmx), to an absolute URL without the host name or the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) (/myService.asmx), or to a relative URL (../myService.asmx). The class makes sure that the URL is converted into a form usable by network executors.
The name of the Web service method to invoke.

(Optional) false if the Web request HTTP verb is POST; otherwise, true. The default is false.The call to the Web service will fail if the verb defined by does not match the setting of the corresponding Web server method. For example, the following code (in C#) requires that the call be made with a GET verb: [ScriptMethod(UseHttpGet=true)]

(Optional) A JavaScript dictionary that contains named properties (fields) that correspond to the parameters of the method to call, as in this example:{"param1":196610,"param2":"Hello"}The field names in the dictionary must match the names of Web service methods.If the Web server method does not take any parameters, can be left out or can be null or an empty dictionary ({}). Any values that you pass are then ignored.If the dictionary contains key/value pairs that do not correspond to a parameter of the Web server method, they are ignored.

(Optional) The function that is invoked as a callback if the Web service method call returns successfully. can be set to null if you do not need it and if you must specify a value for the remaining parameters. If no callback function is provided, no action is taken when the Web service method finishes successfully.

(Optional) The function that is invoked as a callback if the Web service method call fails. can be set to null if you do not need it and if you must specify a value for the remaining parameters. If no callback function is provided, no action is taken if an error occurs during the Web service method call.

(Optional) Any user-specific information. can be any JavaScript primitive type, array, or object. The contents of are passed to the callback functions (if any). If is not provided, null is passed to the callback function.

(Optional) The time in milliseconds that the network executor must wait before timing out the Web request. can be an integer or null. By defining a time-out interval, you can control the time that the application must wait for the callback to finish.
